title: fix: added support for decorate with the SVG multi-series
body:
fixes #11 

should allow completion of https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-technical-indicator/pull/37

NOTE: I have not added support for canvas multi decoration. This is because with canvas series the decorate function is inserted before the series performs its rendering logic. The multi series doesn't have an insertion point that makes sense.

title: Should we be merging enter and update
body:
See: https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-data-join/blob/master/src/dataJoin.js#L40

This makes migration of old d3fc components easier, but is it the correct thing to do? It threw me a little when updating d3fc-axis because my mind was thinking along the lines of D3v4 data joins, where the two are not merged automatically.

title: Update all dependencies 🌴
body:
Hello lovely humans,

**welcome to automated dependency management with [Greenkeeper](https://greenkeeper.io)**.
To take full advantage of this service I recommend to start out with up-to-date dependencies.

I just **updated all the dependencies in the `package.json`** file in one go.
Please look into these changes and make sure your project still works with them applied.
If you can’t update everything right now that’s fine as well.
We’ll get there over time.

Now that you told me to monitor this project **I’ll create a branch for every dependency update**, with the new version applied. The branch creation should trigger your testing services to check the new version. Using the results of these tests I’ll try to open meaningful and helpful pull requests, so your dependencies remain working and up-to-date.

```diff
-  "underscore": "^1.6.0"
+  "underscore": "^1.7.0"
```

In the above example you can see an in-range update. `1.7.0` is included in the old `^1.6.0` range, because of the [caret `^` character ](https://docs.npmjs.com/misc/semver#ranges).
When there is a failure reported for the update I’ll create a pull request so you know about the problem immediately. When it reports success I’ll delete the branch again, because no action needs to be taken – everything is fine.

This way every single version update of your dependencies will either continue to work with your project, or you’ll get to know of potential problems immediately :sparkles:

```diff
-  "lodash": "^3.0.0"
+  "lodash": "^4.0.0"
```

In this example the new version `4.0.0` is not included in the old `^3.0.0` range.
For version updates like these – let’s call them “out of range” updates – you’ll receive a pull request right away.

Now **you no longer need to check for exciting new versions by hand** – I’ll just let you know automatically.
And the pull request will not only serve as a reminder to update. In case it passes your decent test suite that’s a strong reason to merge right away :shipit:

Are you unsure about how things are supposed to work?

There is a collection of [frequently asked questions](https://greenkeeper.io/faq.html) and of course you may always [ask my humans](https://github.com/greenkeeperio/greenkeeper/issues/new).

Good luck with your project and see you soon :sparkles:

:palm_tree:

---
This pull request was created by [greenkeeper.io](https://greenkeeper.io/).

<sub>Tired of seeing this sponsor message? :zap: `greenkeeper upgrade`</sub>

title: decorate property missing from multi series
body: https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-series/blob/master/src/multiBase.js

title: Allow auto-resize on surfaces
body:
Possible enhancement to allow `auto-resize` to be applied to `d3fc-svg` & `d3fc-canvas`. 

Workaround is to wrap the element in a `d3fc-group`.

title: The 'ticks' component does not reflect the behaviour of d3-axis
body:
The ticks property has some slightly funky behaviour:

>Sets the arguments that will be passed to scale.ticks and scale.tickFormat when the axis is rendered, and returns the axis generator.

https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_ticks

Which you can see being replicated in d3fc:

https://github.com/ScottLogic/d3fc/blob/master/src/scale/ticks.js#L25

However, the d3fc-annotation ticks component des not perform this 'argument capturing' logic.

title: Remove 'flexbox' attributes
body: For d3fcv4 we will not be using flexbox, so no need to add `layout-width` / `layout-height` attributes

title: d3fc-scripts@1.4.1 breaks build 🚨
body:
Hello lovely humans, [d3fc-scripts](https://www.npmjs.com/package/d3fc-scripts) just published its new version 1.4.1.
State Failing tests :rotating_light:
Dependency d3fc-scripts
New version 1.4.1
Type devDependency
This version is **covered** by your **current version range** and after updating it in your project **the build went from success to failure**. As d3fc-scripts is “only” a devDependency of this project it **might not break production or downstream projects**, but “only” your build or test tools – **preventing new deploys or publishes**. I recommend you give this issue a high priority. I’m sure you can resolve this :muscle: Of course this could just be a false positive, caused by a flaky test suite, or third parties that are currently broken or unavailable, but that would be another problem I’d recommend working on. Do you have any ideas how I could improve these pull requests? Did I report anything you think isn’t right? Are you unsure about how things are supposed to work? There is a collection of [frequently asked questions](https://greenkeeper.io/faq.html) and while I’m just a bot, there is a group of people who are happy to teach me new things. [Let them know](https://github.com/greenkeeperio/greenkeeper/issues/new). Good luck with your project :sparkles: You rock! :palm_tree: --- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-scripts/releases/tag/v1.4.1)

1.4.1 (2016-09-19)

Bug Fixes

  • add missing dependency (#22) (01d8a4aa)
--- The new version differs by 11 commits . - [`01d8a4a`](https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-scripts/commit/01d8a4aa9787490a0d7275d9c73fa1f5809b0470) fix: add missing dependency (#22) - [`5652b20`](https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-scripts/commit/5652b20d8ec714bc278f74962bfacdca6605d935) test: add test result output - [`83a0759`](https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-scripts/commit/83a075946c8b4288d6c9d44f0e5e2b5ab96f47a1) chore(package): update babel-preset-es2015 to version 6.14.0 (#3) - [`1249620`](https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-scripts/commit/1249620a01d4705ae74f195e410e3f43db73bc06) chore(package): update rollup to version 0.35.11 (#17) - [`3bb5fc2`](https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-scripts/commit/3bb5fc2082dc634b158d932ab642e49b14308d2c) feat: add examples folder to eslint glob (#18) - [`ffedb5c`](https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-scripts/commit/ffedb5c137c4f7d161b66bad8f9e8238a1424e47) Merge pull request #15 from alisd23/master - [`e5d0a65`](https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-scripts/commit/e5d0a6584d289d9fcb4fa5079eb58892b0e4a99a) feat: add node resolution - [`a6c3970`](https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-scripts/commit/a6c39706248020d53628049136aaa69af6154fe8) feat: add any d3 or d3fc lib to rollup globals - [`9fd7fda`](https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-scripts/commit/9fd7fdae12be88e273b93f0ae65dd00e898e2488) Merge pull request #4 from chrisprice/master - [`9878286`](https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-scripts/commit/98782865df97449a55d919b1e107391a6485d50b) fix: catch unhandled promise error - [`7a81ce5`](https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-scripts/commit/7a81ce5277d4f1647cb194531da8e65945a622a8) docs: remove reference to archetype-project See the [full diff](https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-scripts/compare/43ab87f5ee1f017b9958e66fd8e9c2929a4734f1...01d8a4aa9787490a0d7275d9c73fa1f5809b0470). --- This pull request was created by [greenkeeper.io](https://greenkeeper.io/). Tired of seeing this sponsor message? :zap: `greenkeeper upgrade`

title: Investigate using object tag for resize notifications
body:
Possible enhancement to allow all element resize events to be tracked. This [post](http://www.backalleycoder.com/2013/03/18/cross-browser-event-based-element-resize-detection/) explains the technique.

Current workaround is to manually invoke `requestRedraw` when a resize triggering action occurs.

title: Add examples folder
body: Similar to d3fc-series/d3fc-annotation. Should re-purpose the code from scottlogic/d3fc `src/indicators`.

title: The screenshot margins are a little out
body: see: https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-series/blob/master/screenshots/errorbar.png

title: Canvas equivalents?
body: Currently all components are implemented as SVG only components.

title: Boxplot has z-index issues when rendering to canvas
body: The image above shows the same series rendered with SVG (left) and canvas (right). The mean line is missing from the canvas rendering.

title: Unexpected behaviour if you don't provide a seed value
body:
```
fc.randomGeometricBrownianMotion()()
```

Gives

```
[undefined, NaN, NaN, ...]
```

I think it would be friendlier if, in the absence of a seed value, we defaulted to zero.

On that note, why isn't the seed a component property?

title: extentTime not extentDate
body: To match d3's scaleTime rather than scaleDate

title: Annealing doesn't seem to give stable results
body: Not sure if it's inherently unstable or if it's caused by a random initialisation, if so is there a reasonable, deterministic initial placement algorithm we could use?

title: Very slow demo
body: I think it's because of the overlap calculation, maybe using d3-quadtree would speed it up?

title: feat: implement the iterable protocol
body: Fix #1

title: Work out path to integrating with stochastic package
body: https://github.com/NathanEpstein/stochastic

title: Implement iterator protocol
body: For stream

title: Automate gh-pages deployment
body: Currently this is manually triggered via `npm run site-deploy`
